item.title: How Long Is Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Campaign Length Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Are you curious about how long it takes to beat Wuchang: Fallen Feathers? The campaign itself is long and arduous, filled with numerous challenges that serve to test your skills. If you're patient, then you might just reach the game's conclusion.

How long to beat Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Campaign length guide

If you're ready to dive straight into a dark fantasy adventure in Ming Dynasty China, then you need to allot enough time for the campaign. On average, it should take you roughly 25 to 35 hours to beat Wuchang: Fallen Feathers on your first try. Granted, this is primarily if you just focus on the main objectives, but we also take character deaths into consideration given the challenge presented by numerous bosses.

If you want to tackle optional content, then you might spend anywhere from 40 to 50 hours as you explore every nook and cranny. Of course, there's also New Game+ mode, a staple among soulslike games, which further increases your playtime.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers campaign structure

As far as beating Wuchang: Fallen Feathers' campaign goes, you might be wondering about the structure or presentation itself. Here's a quick summary that's fairly light on spoilers:

  • The initial area, Worship's Rise, consists of several sprawling areas. These include Reverent Temple, Shu Sanctum, Tang Palace, and various caverns and villages.
  • Upon finishing the key objectives, you can head to a junction point. One path leads to the snow-capped peaks of Cloudspire, while another takes you to the temples and pavilions of Mount Zhenwu.
  • Naturally, there are other locations, but we don't want to spoil you with all the details here.
  • All of these areas are crawling with insidious enemies and ferocious bosses. Needless to say, your speed of completion will depend on the viability of your build and weapons, as well as your overall skill when it comes to soulslike action.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers additional objectives

Generally speaking, progression normally entails defeating enemies/bosses, leveling up using Red Mercury, and buying/upgrading your gear. That said, there are other activities that you can tackle while you're exploring distant lands, such as:

  • Wu Gang items - You can gather valuables to unlock new items for Wu Gang, a vendor NPC in your hub.
  • Echoes of the Past - There are points-of-interest that grant rewards if you pick the right emote.
  • NPC quests - Some NPCs have quest chains, though they tend to be cryptic regarding clues. And, yes, you might be able to summon companions, too.
  • Giant Panda Bamboo Shoots - Little Bamboo Shoots run around when they spot you. Collect and exchange these with the Giant Panda NPC.
  • Optional locations - There are certain areas that you won't visit as part of the main story, but you can reach them if you're keen on exploring.

That does it for our guide on how long it takes to beat Wuchang: Fallen Feathers. Other activities are a given when playing soulslike games, such as obtaining all weapons, armors, and spells, so you can expect to add more hours if you're a completionist. Last but not least, completing the story lets you start New Game+ mode. You keep all sorts of goodies, and you get to experience the whole thing all over again.

Many dangers await you as you venture forth in Sichuan Province during the fall of the Ming Dynasty. If you need more help, we've got you covered with our Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Preorders For Exploration-Focused Action RPG Hell Is Us Are Now Live
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There's no shortage of open-world souls-like games these days, but Hell Is Us--which launches for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on September 4--puts a new twist on the action-RPG genre by emphasizing immersive exploration--there's no map, waypoints, or quest markers, so you'll need to learn the in-game environments to navigate the world. If that premise intrigues you, you can preorder the game now in multiple versions, including a $60 physical standard edition and $80 Deluxe Edition on PS5 and Xbox Series X. While there are no in-game preorder bonus items announced for Hell Is Us, those who grab the Deluxe Edition will get three-day early access to the full game starting September 1, plus a bunch of digital extras exclusive to this version--so consider grabbing it if you're eager to try out the new sci-fi action RPG.

Hell Is Us

$60 | Releases September 4

The standard edition keeps things simple--you get the full game on your platform of choice. If you opt for the physical version on PS5 or Xbox Series X, you'll also get a boxed copy to add to your shelf. Preorders are available at Amazon and Walmart. Digital preorders are also available on the PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, and Steam.

PS5

  • Amazon
  • Walmart

Xbox Series X

  • Amazon
  • Walmart

Hell Is Us: Deluxe Edition

$80 | Releases September 1

The Hell is Us: Deluxe Edition includes the base game on your platform of choice--including early access to the full game starting September 1--plus a unique steelbook case, a digital soundtrack and art book, and a list of bonus in-game items. Here's a look at everything included:

  • Hell Is Us base game
  • 3-day early access starting September 1
  • Military Pack skins for Remi and drone
  • Hollow Walker and Phol Guard skins for Remi
  • Hollow Walker and Phol guard skins for drone
  • Digital soundtrack
  • Digital art book
  • A secret code for an unrevealed in-game bonus

Physical copies of the Hell is Us: Deluxe Edition are available to preorder for $80 at Amazon and Walmart. A digital version is also available from the PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, and Steam--though the digital version does not include the steelbook case.

Set in the early '90s in the fictionalized hermit nation of Hadea, players take on the role of Remi. Returning to his nation of birth, Remi is aiming to learn more about his past and find his parents, but that's easier said than done when the landscape around him is being torn apart by a phenomenon called the Calamity, which has introduced violent creatures to the country.

What sets Hell Is Us apart is that it refuses to hold your hand, as you'll need to pay attention during conversations, gather clues, and use that knowledge to chart your own path forward. "Some players will thrive on the level of player agency Hell is Us offers, while others will butt their heads against it and quit in frustration," Dan Ryckert wrote in GameSpot's Hell Is Us preview. "I'm leaning toward the former--this is a game filled with bold, confident, deliberate design decisions on the part of Rogue Factor, and it'll be interesting to see how players react when it releases September 4."

Several other games are available to preorder now, so if exploring a dystopian landscape while fighting for your life doesn't appeal to you, you can instead grab upcoming titles like Pokemon Legends: Z-A or Bluey: The Video Game.

item.title: Elgato Reveals New Budget-Friendly 4K 60FPS Capture Device, The Elgato 4K S
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Elgato makes some of the most popular streaming equipment on the market, including the Game Capture HD60 X and Game Capture Neo--and not the company has announced a new entry to its capture card lineup, the Elgato 4K S, which is positioned as the company's new entry-level option. The new capture card supports PC and all major consoles--including PS5, Xbox Series X, and Switch 2--and is capable of capturing gameplay in up to 4K resolution at 60fps. If you're considering upgrading your streaming or gameplay capture setup, the Elgato 4K S is available now for $160 at Amazon.

Elgato 4K S

$160

As stated above, this new capture card records gameplay at up to 4K 60fps. For comparison, the company's previous HD60 X could only record at 60fps in 1080p, dropping to 30fps for 4K footage--that should make for an appreciable upgrade for those upgrading to this new capture card. The Elgato 4K S features a USB-C port (5Gbps) and two HDMI 2.0 ports. Setup is just as easy as Elgato's other gadgets, requiring little more a USB-C and two HDMI cables to connect the card to your display, gameplay output source, and PC or recording device.

Early reviews of the Elgato 4K S are overwhelmingly positive, with users noting its portable form factor, minimal input lag, and capture quality. So if you're a creator looking to make the jump to 4K content without breaking the bank, the Elgato 4K S certainly seems like it's worth a closer look.

While this is a leap over the HD60 X, the Elgato 4K S is not a replacement for the premium Elgato 4K X ($245), which is capable of capturing 4K footage at up to 144fps. The 4K X also offers a few additional bonuses, such as added HDR support, HDMI 2.1 ports, and 10Gbps USB-C ports. While most streamers will be just fine sticking with the 4K S's 4K 60fps capture quality, those who demand the highest quality will still find the 4K X the better option.

item.title: Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny Collector's Edition Includes Trading Cards, Dice, And More
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Nickelodeon Universe is overflowing with cool shows--from SpongeBob and Avatar to The Fairly OddParents and Rugrats, the network has built up an impressive catalog over the past few decades. Soon, fans will get to assemble a team of Nicktoons characters for an epic adventure with Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny, launching on September 30 for PS5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam. The kid-friendly action RPG features whimsical graphics and simplified gameplay. Preorders are now open ahead of launch at multiple online retailers. While there are no preorder bonuses announced yet, the game will be available in standard and Collector's Editions, with the latter bundling a bunch of physical collectibles and bonus content.

Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny Collector's Edition

$80 | Releases September 30

The $80 Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny Collector's Edition is a physical version of the game, available for Switch and PS5, that includes the base game, along with a variety of collectible items and the Wardrobe of Wonder DLC code, which includes additional in-game cosmetics. Here's everything in the Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny Collector's Edition:

  • Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny base game
  • Wardrobe of Wonder DLC pack
  • Wooden Dice Tray with Storage Compartment
  • Custom Dice Set and Travel Pouch
  • 9 Collectible Hero Trading Cards
  • Sticker Sheet

That's a pretty nice lineup of gear for what amounts to $10 more than most of today's standard $70 releases. Preorders are available at Target and GameStop.

Nicktoons & The Dice of Destiny is a top-down action RPG designed for younger players--so expect something much simpler and more forgiving than similar games in the genre like Path of Exile 2 or Diablo 4. Players choose from a list of characters that includes SpongeBob, Sandy Cheeks, Timmy, Katara, and more--each of which has their own skills and strategies to master and unlock--and adventure through a series-hopping crossover storyline in solo and cooperative gameplay modes.

item.title: Seagate Has Terrific Deals On High-Capacity Desktop Hard Drives This Week
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're in the market for a high-capacity backup hard drive for your PC or Mac, you'll want to check out Seagate's exclusive deals on desktop expansion HDDs this week. Seagate's popular external hard drive with 6TB of storage space is discounted to only $110 (was $160). That's a terrific deal on a drive of this size. You can get even more bang for your buck by opting for the 14TB model for $200--a savings of $120 from its original $320 price.

The 6TB and 14TB configurations are exclusive to Seagate, so there isn't a direct comparison to be made with competitor pricing. at major retailers, but for comparison, Amazon has the 8TB model for $161 (was $170). The 12TB model sells for around $260 at Amazon, so 60 bucks more for two fewer terabytes.

Seagate Expansion Desktop Hard Drive

Save big on 6TB to 28TB HDDs only at Seagate.

Seagate also has exclusive discounts on the 18TB, 22TB, and 28TB models. The 18TB has the steepest discount ($130), dropping it to just $220. Best Buy, for instance, is selling this model for $300.

The largest configuration is the 28TB version, but you're better off going with the 26TB. Though Seagate doesn't list this one as an exclusive deal, the $250 deal price--$100 off--is $50 less than Best Buy's current deal. In any case, spending an extra $80 to jump from 26TB to 28GB doesn't offer good value. The same could be said about the 22TB edition, which is only 10 bucks less than the 26TB model.

The 6TB, 14TB, or 26TB models would be our picks from a value perspective.

  • 6TB -- $110 ($160)
  • 14TB -- $200 ($320)
  • 18TB -- $220 ($350)
  • 22TB -- $240 ($300)
  • 26TB -- $250 ($350)
  • 28TB -- $330 ($390)

Regardless of which size you choose, you'll get a three-year limited warranty with Rescue Data Recovery Services included for added peace of mind, support for USB 3.0 connections for faster file transfers, and a straightforward installation process that simply requires plugging in a power adapter and connecting the drive to a USB port on your PC or Mac.

While this HDD probably isn't the best spot to put games (save those for a faster SSD), it's a good way to offload pictures, videos, and other files from your PC.

All the drives feature a minimalist design, as they're essentially a black box with a few accents and cutouts. If you've seen Silicon Valley, it's eerily similar to "The Box." At any rate, it should blend in with most setups, and the drives are fairly compact at roughly 7 x 5 x 1 inches (on average).
